commits.author: Michael Sheets
commits.summary: Don't require whitespace after include directive
commits.body: Whitespace is not required to be present for compilation, fixes #23.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Update platform definitions

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Don’t scope <kbd class='tabTrigger'>for⇥</kbd> loop to Objective-C(++)
commits.body: There is an NSUInteger-based for loop snippet in the Objective-C bundle.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Move symbols from /usr/include to its own Platform grammar file
commits.body: This makes it easier to automatically update the grammar.

commits.author: Andy Herbert
commits.summary: Enable enumeration snippet in C/Obj-C files (<kbd class='tabTrigger'>enum⇥</kbd>)

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Match ‘final’ and ‘override’ keywords (C++11)
commits.body: Also add actual “storage” keyword to the scope name (both these and a few others).

commits.author: Adam Strzelecki
commits.summary: Append -assume-filename=<path> to clang-format
commits.body:
This makes 'file' style to work, as clang-format needs to know file path to
resolve possible .clang-format style definition files placement.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Improve filename → identifier conversion in snippets
commits.body: Also use document’s display name (relevant for untitled documents).

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Add ‘thread_local’ storage modifier keyword to C++ grammar

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Single quotes are not paired for integer literals
commits.body:
This way one can add the single quotes while typing without TextMate auto-inserting the end quote.

With a selection, single quotes are still paired (even when the selection is a string literal), assuming that people want wrapping rather than overwriting.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Support binary integer literals and digit separators
commits.body:
Example: 0b10000000'00000000'00000000'00000000

I rewrote the pattern to match integer literals so it’s stricter though will still match a partially typed number like ‘0x’ or one with a trailing digit separator (also considered partially typed), although here it marks the trailing separator as invalid.

commits.author: Adam Strzelecki
commits.summary: Reformat Document using clang-format
commits.body:
http://clang.llvm.org/docs/ClangFormat.html

Passes `-style` argument using `TM_CLANG_FORMAT_STYLE` variable, defaulting to LLVM.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Limit “Insert Call to Constructors” (:<kbd class='keyEquivalent'>⇥</kbd>) to when caret is at EOL

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Register #if…#else…#endif as highlight pairs
commits.body: This is mainly to allow selecting a block with <kbd class='keyEquivalent'>⇧⌘B</kbd>.

commits.author: Martin Donath
commits.summary: Added sizeof to second keyword ignore list

commits.author: Martin Donath
commits.summary: Corrected keyword highlighting of sizeof within function calls

commits.author: Martin Donath
commits.summary: Identifiers with a ‘_t’ are marked up as (POSIX reserved) types

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Use clang as default compiler (<kbd class='keyEquivalent'>⌘R</kbd> and “Insert Missing Includes”)
commits.body:
Clang is called via ‘xcrun clang’ so it requires that you have Xcode installed.

If you wish to use another compiler you can set ‘TM_GCC’ and ‘TM_GXX’ for C/Objective-C and C++/Objective-C++ respectively. This variable is no longer being “shell escaped” (which is what allows setting it to something like ‘xcrun clang’).

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Remove “Compile to CLI Tool”
commits.body: I think this command is obsoleted by the ability to run (<kbd class='keyEquivalent'>⌘R</kbd>) a single file.

commits.author: Joachim Mårtensson
commits.summary: Make completion files adhere to convention in objc bundle

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Use “zero indent” for preprocessor lines

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Remove indentation rules for comments
commits.body: This was scoped globally and will re-appear in the source bundle.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Do normal parsing after ‘#endif’
commits.body:
The ‘#endif’ rule would match until end-of-line, presumably because no code is supposed to be here, though the user could place comments in this location.

Fixes #13.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Match ‘nullptr’ and ‘constexpr’
commits.body: Closes #10.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Always decrease indent for leading end brace
commits.body:
Previously we would only decrease indent if the closing brace was followed by a few known constructs like ‘while(…);’, end parentheses, a non-string followed by opening brace, etc.

Testing against my own sources, I can’t find any construct that should have a closing brace (when leading) not decrease the indent, so I am making this match less strict.

Closes #11.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Handle block comments before end braces better

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Simplify indent pattern
commits.body: We were effectively repeating ourself in this pattern.

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Don’t increase indent for lines terminated with comma

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Remove ‘tr1’ namespace from shared_ptr snippet

commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.summary: Let TextMate save (on <kbd class='keyEquivalent'>⌘R</kbd>) unless document is untitled
commits.body: This is a subtle change but it means that all but untitled documents are saved by TextMate where previously the command would always be responsible for saving, which meant encoding, callbacks, and similar weren’t respected, and there was a theoretical synchronization problem (TextMate having to get notified that the file changed on disk and notice that it was (now) identical to the modified version in memory).
